CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 2, 1955, page 28, reads: "New Fire Engine - The Wandless Street Fire Station, officially Engine House 26, on Tuesday received a new $17,000 pumper to aid in effective fire fighting. In the picture, Mayor David L. Lawrence, flanked by Councilman Paul F. Jones, turns over the keys to the mobile unit to driver Edward King as (left to right) Fire Chief Stephen Adley, and Captains Sid Ferguson and Frank Clark, in uniforms, watch. - Harris Photo."David L. Lawrence was Mayor of the City of Pittsburgh 1946-1959, Governor of Pennsylvania 1959-1963, and he died in 1966.
TitMainTitle: Fire Chief Stephen Adley standing on fire truck, with driver Edward King, Captains Sid Ferguson and Frank Clark in uniforms, and Pittsburgh Mayor David L. Lawrence handing keys, with councilman Paul F. Jones next to him, outside of Wandless Street Engine House No. 26, 2854 Webster Avenue Hill District
